intro: Angelica duclouxii, commonly known as the Alpine angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a biennial or perennial herb that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, featuring large, compound leaves with a distinctive aromatic scent. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-shaped clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Angelica duclouxii thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
